GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: This file contains the metadata, events, and data for REDCap project "PROTECT Site Survey".

redcap:Surveys.title: PROTECT: Prophylactic Therapy in Care Homes Trial
redcap:Surveys.instructions:
We are planning a study that will test treatments intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19 within care homes, and reduce the risks of hospitalisation and death. These treatments will be given in addition to the roll-out of vaccines. Care homes will be randomly allocated (like a toss of a coin) to either active treatment or usual care.

The following questions ask for key information about your care home that will help us in planning the study. The survey should take only 10 minutes to complete. Any information given in responding to this survey will be used by the research team and may be shared with other organisations involved in supporting the set-up and delivery of the trial (for this purpose only).

Thank you,

Professor Philip Bath

PROTECT-Trial@Nottingham.ac.uk
redcap:Surveys.acknowledgement: Thank you for your interest in the PROTECT study. A member of the study team will be in touch with you soon.
redcap:Surveys.response_limit_custom_text: Thank you for your interest; however, the survey is closed because the maximum number of responses has been reached.

redcap:Alerts.email_subject: PROTECT Trial - Expression of interest survey
redcap:Alerts.alert_message:
Dear [home_person],

Thank you for taking the time to fill in the PROTECT Trial site survey. This has been received by the research team at the Nottingham Clinical Trials Unit who are coordinating the study. A member of the research team will be in touch with you within the next few days to give you more information about the study and discuss what taking part would involve for your care home.

For more information about the PROTECT Trial please visit https://www.protect-trial.net or contact us either by e-mail protect-trial@nottingham.ac.uk or by phone on 0115 748 7710.

With best wishes

The PROTECT Trial Team

Decode.TranslatedText: Outstanding (The service is performing exceptionally well)
Good (The service is performing well and meeting our expectations)
Requires improvement (The service is not performing as well as it should and we have told the service how it must improve)
Inadequate (The service is performing badly and we've taken action against the person or organisation that runs it)
Good (Important strengths, with some areas for improvement)
Unsatisfactory (Major weaknesses - urgent remedial action required)
